name: unshakeably
content:

in a way that shows a firm belief that cannot be made weaker or destroyed : He remains unshakeably convinced that he is right. They believed unshakeably that the two countries should stand together. Related word
unshakeableSynonyms
firmly (CERTAINLY)
unwaveringly (WITHOUT CHANGING)
More examplesFewer examplesThey were unshakeably opposed to war.Teachers and parents are unshakeably optimistic about the vast majority of children being able to master the curriculum. These are extremely successful politicians who are unshakeably focused on holding onto power.Just one year ago, support for the president appeared unshakeably solid.He knew instantly and unshakeably that he wanted to become a writer.
